meta.title: Nonresidential Building Commissioning (CXR-E)
meta.authority: California Energy Commission — 2022 Energy Code (Title 24, Part 6)
meta.relevance: Required for all nonresidential new construction and major alterations; common correction trigger when missing or incomplete

overview.description: The NRCC-CXR-E is the Certificate of Compliance for nonresidential building commissioning (Cx) under the 2022 California Energy Code. It documents that building systems have been designed to enable proper commissioning and that a commissioning plan is in place.
when_required: Major alterations to nonresidential buildings where HVAC or lighting systems are substantially modified
High-rise residential buildings (>3 stories above grade)
overview.who_completes: Design professional of record (architect or engineer) responsible for the systems being commissioned
overview.submission_timing: Submitted with building permit application as part of the NRCC package; updated versions may be required at plan check corrections

related_forms.description: Performance compliance approach — overall building energy model

design_phase.description: Requirements that must be documented during design/permit application phase

items.detail: Written plan identifying systems to be commissioned, testing procedures, schedule, and responsible parties
items.common_correction: Missing or incomplete commissioning plan is one of the top 5 nonresidential plan check corrections

items.detail: Document stating the owner's functional requirements for building systems, including energy efficiency goals
Document describing the design approach for meeting the OPR, including system descriptions and design criteria
Technical specifications included in the construction documents describing commissioning procedures for each system
Narrative describing how the design achieves the commissioning requirements of the energy code
Systematic testing of each commissioned system under various operating conditions (full load, part load, failure modes)
Final report documenting all test results, deficiencies found, corrections made, and system performance verification
Evidence that building operations staff received training on commissioned systems

hvac.description: Heating, ventilation, and air conditioning systems
hvac.applicable_when: All new HVAC systems in nonresidential buildings

lighting_controls.applicable_when: All new lighting systems in nonresidential buildings

building_envelope.applicable_when: Projects pursuing advanced commissioning or where envelope performance is critical

advanced_commissioning.description: Enhanced commissioning requirements that go beyond basic code compliance
when_triggered: Buildings over 10,000 sq ft conditioned area
Buildings with complex HVAC systems (multiple zones, central plant)
Projects claiming energy credits for advanced commissioning

additional_requirements.detail: Post-occupancy energy monitoring system capable of measuring whole-building energy use and major end uses, with fault detection and diagnostics
Commissioning conducted by an independent agent not on the design or construction team
Functional testing under both heating and cooling conditions (may require return visit)
Comprehensive operating manual for all commissioned systems including sequences of operation, maintenance schedules, and troubleshooting guides

common_corrections.description: Commissioning plan not included with permit application
common_corrections.resolution: Submit complete commissioning plan per Section 120.8 requirements

common_corrections.description: Commissioning plan does not cover all required systems (often missing lighting controls or DHW)
common_corrections.resolution: Expand commissioning plan to include all systems per Tables 120.8-A and 120.8-B

common_corrections.description: Design review narrative not provided or does not address energy code compliance
common_corrections.resolution: Provide design review narrative addressing OPR, BOD, and code requirements

common_corrections.description: Commissioning plan does not identify the responsible commissioning professional
common_corrections.resolution: Identify commissioning agent with qualifications per Section 120.8(a)

common_corrections.description: Required NRCA acceptance test forms not referenced or included in commissioning plan
common_corrections.resolution: Include applicable NRCA forms (LTI-04, MCH-04, etc.) and identify when each will be completed

common_corrections.description: NRCC-CXR-E compliance certificate not included in the Title 24 documentation package
common_corrections.resolution: Complete and submit NRCC-CXR-E signed by design professional of record

sf_specific_notes.detail: San Francisco DBI reviews commissioning documentation during M-06 (Mechanical) and M-08 (Energy) plan check stages. Missing CXR-E is flagged as a correction that holds permit issuance.

SF's green building ordinance (AB-093) may require commissioning beyond Title 24 minimums for new construction and major alterations, including enhanced commissioning per LEED or GreenPoint Rated requirements.
Functional performance tests for HVAC and lighting controls must be witnessed by a DBI inspector or approved third-party. Schedule through the DBI online inspection request system.

Commissioning report and acceptance test results must be provided before DBI issues Certificate of Final Completion. Green Building Final Compliance form (AB-093 Attachment E) is also required for applicable projects.

estimate_timeline.note: Projects requiring commissioning typically add 1-3 weeks to the overall permit timeline due to plan check review of Cx documentation and potential corrections
